fields.description:
This is an incompatibility found in CVS. Since Bamboo runs checkouts using the "-D" option, the problem will always happen for CVS tags.

Example that fails (using a Tag):
{code}
checkout -P -N -kb -r TAG-001 -D '2010-07-28 08:34:20 +0200' build
{code}

Example that works (using a Branch):
{code}
checkout -P -N -kb -r BNCH-001 -D '2010-07-28 08:34:20 +0200' build
{code}

The workaround is to use option -DCVS_FORCE_CHECKOUT_TO_LATEST=true in the JAVA_OPTS.

A fix for Bamboo would be to:

1. Always force the checkout to happen in the latest version (without "-D") 

OR

2. Detect if the Plan owner used a Branch or Tag. If a Tag, request for confirmation that a _force latest checkout_ can be done (explain potential performance issues).
fields.summary: CVS Checkout/Update does not work with options "-r" and "-D" for Tags

fields.description: If you delete a user who is currently logged in.  The UI looks like the person is logged out.  But Bamboo behaves as though you are logged in. (e.g. You click the log in link because it looks like your logged out, but then you don't get the login page, cause the system already thinks your logged in and there is no log out link so you can't change what the system thinks).
fields.summary: Deletion of logged in user causes wierd logged in state.

fields.description:
The Bamboo Plans gadget can take a very long time to load. While it is loading it seems to create a very large number of connections to the host container. This means that any other gadgets on the same page that want to refresh are blocked because of the connection limit in the browser. This is a problem in particular if the user has authenticated another gadget, as they will not see that the gadgets is authenticated until the Bamboo Plans gadget is done.

See CONFDEV-452 for context.
fields.summary: Bamboo Plans gadgets creates lots of connection to the gadget container. This blocks other gadgets from refreshing.

fields.description:
When you edit the plan's permissions, and you are not a global admin, it will not show you any of the global admin people's permissions.  You can not then remove the admin permission from yourself.  The warning is: "There must be at least one person with these permissions".   But there is someone else with those permissions, they are just not visible to the current user.  So we either need to 
# fix the error message and say you can't change your own permissions 
# show everyone, even global admins.  
# or check for the admin users when doing the save, and only error out if you are REALLY the last person..

It would be even nicer to show everything and actually disable the checkboxes you are not allowed to edit.
fields.summary: Editing Permissions when not full admin weirdness

fields.description:
With large numbers of plans and agents, this page is almost unusable. Scrolling down or left means you can't see the agent/plan name in the matix, so the hovers (which sometimes appear in the wrong place, like off the visible screen, BTW) are useless - you don't know which plan/agent it's for.

To help with this, add the plan/agent to the hover (so green ticks would need a hover as well).

Also, I am often only interested in a sub-set of plans, so being able to filter by project or favourites would also make the page more useful/faster.
fields.summary: Agents Matrix Improvements: filters and hovers

fields.description: The default AMI that ships with elastic Bamboo only runs on 32 bit elastic instances.  This means customers can't use large memory instances without creating a custom AMI, which we strongly recommend they don't do because it breaks between upgrades.  I'd like to suggest we have two default AMI's, a 32 bit and a 64 bit, which are automatically selected based on the instance type selected.
fields.summary: Support for x86_64 using default ami

fields.description:
When trying to create a plan using the Maven 2 import, Bamboo cannot authenticate the svn repository. Also, it appears that the same error is generated when trying to manually create a plan; Bamboo is still not able to authenticate the repository.

I created this bug as a blocker because I am not able to use Bamboo at all, and there is no workaround that I can find. I have been trying to make this work most of the weekend.

The svn repository is VisualSVN 2.1.3 running standlone at the following url: http://devtools.georgeludwigtech.com:8081/svn/ 

Bamboo is running as a war under Tomcat 6, the bamboo url is:
http://devtools.georgeludwigtech.com:8080/bamboo

Tomcat 6 is running as a service, and the VM options are -server -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m

I have confirmed that I can log on to and browse the repository using a browser, and I can also check projects in and out with Eclipse.

When I try to create the plan, I receive the following error message:
This is not a valid Subversion Repository: svn: Authentication required for '<http://devtools.georgeludwigtech.com:8081> Subversion Repositories'

I am certain the uname and password are correct for the repository. In the tomcat log, I find the following exception:

hi,

i ll short discribe our deployment: we have some indiviual modul based build for our customers.

so for each customer i have to create at the moment about 20 builds... much overhead ;)

what i whant is, than i click the build button i get a droplist with predefined values . and this value should be integrated in the command line execution of the build

regards

enrico hofmann

fields.description:
Duplicate entries should not appear on requests like this. The duplicate entry (108) has both labels. I have worked around the problem, so not a major problem :).

{noformat}
http://localhost:8301/rest/api/latest/build/XXX-DEF?os_authType=basic&label=testlabel1,testlabel2
{noformat}

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<builds expand="builds"><link rel="self" href="http://localhost:8301/rest/api/latest/build/XXX-DEF"/>
<builds expand="build" size="4" max-result="4" start-index="0">
<build number="108" state="Failed" key="XXX-DEF-108"><link rel="self" href="http://localhost:8301/rest/api/latest/build/XXX-DEF-108"/></build>
<build number="108" state="Failed" key="XXX-DEF-108"><link rel="self" href="http://localhost:8301/rest/api/latest/build/XXX-DEF-108"/></build>

fields.summary: Duplicate build elements returned for label search

fields.description:
currently when creating a plan it is possible to choose 

x Clean working directory after each build

at "Common repository configuration " in the "Source Repository " tab.

This sounds like a good option, but I would prefer that the clean (maybe optional) is only invoked if the build did not report errors. In this case I'll not need the build results any more, but if some problem did occur it often is helpful to go directly to the build directory and see what exactly caused the problem. So in case of errors I would like to keep the build.

So as long as I cannot choose to only delete successful builds I'll have to keep all builds, just in case I might need one.
fields.summary: Clean working directory after each successful build

fields.description:
When a build is running or has yet to be started (e.g., it is cron-based), we are often asking the same question: WHICH COMMITS ARE PART OF THE NEXT/CURRENT BUILD?

You can get this information after the build finishes, but not before.
fields.summary: Ability to see complete list of changed files before build has started or finished

fields.description: Would like to provide (a) user names to ignore or (b) regex's to run against the commit comments that, if matched, would cause the commit to be ignored
fields.summary: Ability to ignore files based on Subversion commit comments or the user who performed the commit

fields.description: The only assistance a user is currently given for excluding/including a file (presumably for change detection) is a link to Java regex documentation. I'm a Perl programmer and after days of trying, I have yet to use this feature successfully. e.g., my file is etc/foo.yaml . What is the regex supposed to be?
fields.summary: Source Repository Settings - Provide example for how to exclude/include a file

fields.description: Do not run a cron-based build if the last build was successful and there were no commits made to Subversion, unless it is a certain day [optional] & time [optional] (e.g., Monday@ 8 pm)
fields.summary: Do not run a cron-based build if there were no checkins and the last build was successful, unless it is a certain day & time

fields.description:
The plan is set to run only after Subversion commits have occurred.

When a build fails at 4 AM, perhaps it's because the database was restarted. The build should automatically re-run at, say, 4:30 AM even though no files have changed.
fields.summary: When plan status is "failed", rerun build every X minutes regardless of whether a file (e.g., in Subversion) was changed

fields.description: We need to see the whole build log (output of script) while the build is in progress. This is possible after the build has finished but why do we have to wait?
fields.summary: View entire log while build is running

fields.description:
Our builds create and modify files and can then fail before they are checked in or deleted. These files pose merge and other issues for subsequent builds. We do not want Bamboo to clean out the directory and start anew because a full checkout takes 45 minutes. We would like Bamboo instead to perform the following before issuing svn update:

svn --non-interactive cleanup
svn --non-interactive resolve -R --accept working .
svn --non-interactive revert -R .

Since "revert" does not have an option to remove files and directories that are not in SVN, we would like Bamboo to do that too.
fields.summary: Subversion cleanup prior to svn update
Test result total time should be from xml report

fields.summary: Exception when viewing dashboard

fields.description:
The version of svnkit we bundle with bamboo doesn't have SASL support:

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ jar tf svnkit-1.3.0.5847.jar | grep Sasl
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ 
{noformat}

If I download it from the website it does (this is a newer version, but apparently older ones have it too):

{noformat}
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ jar tf svnkit.jar | grep Sasl
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator$SVNCallbackHandler.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslInputStream.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslOutputStream.class
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ 
{noformat}

Is there any technical reason we don't bundle the support for SASL authentication?
fields.summary: Test for SASL support with bundled svnkit

fields.description:
When I click on the yellow star, the page refreshes but the star is still there. I've tried a few times with different builds on BDAC and BEAC, and I can't seem to remove the favourite star from a build. I've tried on the following screens:

- dashboard, 'My' tab
- plan summary screen
- edit plan configuration screen
- project summary screen.

I think the underlying functionality must be broken somehow.
fields.summary: Cannot remove favourite from build

fields.description:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100720-dns2r86dpt6dhi6h1i8en1hctf.png!

We need to display similar information to the Basic Plans:
* The right status for a chain (success, failed, building)
* As much information we have about the latest chain result
* Operations would be nice
fields.summary: Chain should appear with the correct status, latest chain result link on the dashboard

fields.description:
Code that is under CVS control was not being updated to the latest version when I ran a clean Bamboo build.  After digging around in the logs I noticed this was the checkout command being run:
{quote}
cvs checkout -P -N -kb -D 2010-07-19 10:11:33 -0700 [path to code]
{quote}

However, because the value of the "-D" argument was not quoted, the time and offset were not used when checking out the code.  A "cvs status" call returns this:
{quote}
===================================================================
File: TestPath.py       Status: Up-to-date

   Working revision:    1.82    2010-07-19 14:11:38 -0700
   Repository revision: 1.82    /rel/cvsroot/mod/python/studio/utils/path/unittest/TestPath.py,v
   Commit Identifier:   V8Uplzy0awQYnUxu
   Sticky Tag:          (none)
   Sticky Date:         2010.07.19.07.00.00
   Sticky Options:      -kb
{quote}

Notice the correct date, but incorrect time.  When I ran that checkout command manually I see these warnings:
{quote}
cvs checkout: cannot find module `10:11:33' - ignored
cvs checkout: cannot find module `-0700' - ignored
{quote}

When I quote the timestamp I get the correct code version.  I'm currently working around this issue by running Bamboo with the "-DCVS_FORCE_CHECKOUT_TO_LATEST=true" option which doesn't use the "-D" flag on checkout.
fields.summary: CVS checkout command does not quote "-D" argument value

fields.description:
The {{cvsRepository.getSymbolicNameType()}} is set on the server when doing change detection. This property may not be propagated to the agent to tell the agent to ignore the datestamp.

h3. Workaround
To apply the patch on Bamboo 2.6.1:
# Download the 3 class files attached to this ticket, in the following directories:
{code}
../webapps/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/bamboo/repository/cvsimpl/CVSRepository.class
../webapps/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/bamboo/repository/cvsimpl/CvsRepositoryManager.class
../webapps/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/bamboo/utils/SystemProperty.class
{code}
# You will have to create the directory structure if they aren't present in the classes directory.
# Restart Bamboo.

fields.description:
The location of the pom.xml field is very unclear.  It actually expects me to specify the actual file, not just the location.
e.g. /successBuild/pom.xml not /successBuild
So option 1 is to fix the name and description of this field to be more clear.

However, if my pom is in the root directory I end up having to actually right "pom.xml" in this field which is bizzare and unintuitive.  It should do some fancy checks and put "pom.xml" on the end if required.

fields.summary: Exception when importing Maven code
Chain execution does not update revision_key for build, so builds are triggered every change detection in the same context - infinitely
BuildDate should be set for ChainResult

fields.description: If a user has rights to build a plan, he can disable it as well, this might not be desirable in certain conditions.
fields.summary: Disable plans permission
Chain execution should handle empty stages properly

fields.description: When builds are taken off the jms queue but bamboo has not been told about it, the live activity page will show the builds for a second then they fade away, making it slightly harder to clean up the broken builds.
fields.summary: Live Activity for plan does weird things when queue is in wierd state

fields.description:
Default EC2 image needs refresh of tools
- JDK 1.5
- JDK 1.6
fields.summary: Default EC2 image needs refresh of tools

fields.description:
Upgrade to Jetty 7 due to http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY-264

Currently there is no clean way to Proxy Jetty behind Apache-SSL and have Bamboo running on http.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Jetty 7
Drag and drop for moving SubPlan between stages
Ensure notifications aren't run / throw exceptions for SubPlan
User can set up chain failed + 1st success notification
User can set up chain completed notification

fields.description:
There were some reports that bamboo leaves 'orphaned' elastic instances and detached ebs volumes. 
Add functionality to allow admins to view/shutdown instances that are not currently connected to bamboo.
fields.summary: Allow admins to shutdown instances that are not connected to bamboo

fields.description: {{BuildDefinitionManager}} is not made available to plugins for constructor injection. Plugins that deal with BuildDefinition persistence need this since the functionality was moved from BuildManager (BAM-4744).
fields.summary: Make BuildDefinitionManager available to plugins

<bamboo>

fields.description:
Since upgrading our eJabberd application to 2.1.3 Bamboo has been unable to connect to the eJabberd XMPP service.  The "Test" function returns the following error:

XMPP Error encountered while attempting to send message as [bamboo] using [im.xxxxxx.com/Bamboo], error message is: service-unavailable(503)

Looking at errors through the logfile again - including errors related to gss.conf - and I came to the conclusion that the XMPP client Bamboo is using is trying to negotiate authentication that is leading to an authentication mechanism which is not supported by our ejabberd 2.1.3 server.

We did some research and found that ejabberd had addressed a few spec-related issues such as this in recent versions of ejabberd 2.1.3:

https://support.process-one.net/browse/EJAB-1132

    * "SASL PLAIN authentication message not compliant with RFC4616"

The quick summary of the issue is that the XMPP specification has some areas that are vague and open to interpretation. Unless clients and servers interpret the specification the same way - interop problems can exist.

This particular issue was fixed in ejabberd 2.1.2. We reverted our ejabberd installation to 2.0.5 and Bamboo is working again immediately. This tells us that some fix in ejabberd 2.1.0, 2.1.1, 2.1.2, or 2.1.3, possibly the one refered to above, has lead to an interop problem with the XMPP client used in Bamboo.

Pidgin, Exodus, and various other XMPP clients are working fine with our ejabberd 2.1.3 server. This tells us that it is something particular about the XMPP client Bamboo is using. Also, ejabberd is one of the main open source Jabber implementations available with one of the largest user bases of XMPP clients. Putting these together tells us that the XMPP client Bamboo is using is doing something odd. Perhaps not wrong - but at least different from the other clients out there that are working fine.

This issue was initially reported here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-3056
fields.summary: Bamboo does not connect to eJabberd 2.1.3
